website_summaries.verdict: Affordable turntable from a leader in audio tech. 2-speed turntable brings modern convenience to vintage listening.
pros: Can be connected to wireless devices, including headphones and speakers
Gain select switch offers three gain levels
Tone arm moves itself when finished with record
cons: For the entry-level price, some owners say the sound is also entry-level and not as good as other choices

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Set it up this morning, took 10 minutes if that so a good start. I have only played 2 records on it but the sound quality it puts out is fantastic. The sound is so rich and the bass is really deep. It's great. The auto tonearm works just as it should and returns once the record has finished. I have it wired to my hifi and on medium gain, which seems to be spot on so far. I havent tried the bluetooth connection yet, so I can't comment on that. Its a great step up from the turntable I had before in everyway and I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Treble

customer_reviews.title: The Best Consumer Turntable at This Price Point
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally write reviews, but I feel I have to. This turntable is brilliant. The sound quality at this price point is exemplary, and the Bluetooth connectivity is so simple, even a lecturer with a ‘Fine Arts’ degree could use it! The design is great and build is okay, although I would like more ‘clunk’ with the controls. The seller sent it out in a timely fashion, and I’ll definitely shop with them again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Williams

customer_reviews.title: Well priced quality record deck.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a deck without a built in pre-amp and have not been disappointed. Very easy to set up and to use, simplicity in itself. Have had no problems with distortion or background noises. Found the high, medium and low gain output very handy, have left mine on medium. Have not used the Bluetooth facility yet so I cannot comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: DelA

customer_reviews.title: Glad i brought this...
customer_reviews.text: I don't get the negative reviews by some, (and the guy who said it's only suitable for girls and kids is a d***k) even it were at a higher price this is a good product and I am used to decent quality AV equipment. Sound quality is good through decent speakers , I have wireless KEFF and ilouds.
customer_reviews.author: Mr R A Lippiatt

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't play through Samsung Soundbar
customer_reviews.text: Looks a nice piece of kit. Connected with my Samsung Soundbar relatively easily....I could see it registered, BUT! It would not play any sound through the speaker. I could connect it to my TV and play through that, and to a small portable speaker, but it would not play through the Samsung Soundbar, which is what I bought this for. I had researched and the descriptions said it would play through the soundbar, but not this one, so it was useless
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. P. Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Definitely my favourite gadget
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased. This is a temporary measure whilst I rent for three months. I have a Linn in storage so I’m used to very high quality equipment. It is light and well built and the sound via a UE boom box is much better than one would expect. My only reservation is that I don’t think it is an alternative to a good quality standard wired deck and there is substantial stylus noise noticeable on quiet recordings especially. Nevertheless it gets 9/10
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, clear and simple, definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this is an upgrade from my £70 starter record player of four years. Instantly noticed a difference in sound; the clarity, the warmth of the bass, the gaps of pure silence that my past player failed to mute above its rotating motor. The Bluetooth is a handy feature too, of course not first choice for sound quality, but for listening on wireless headphones doing chores around the house, or even to cast to the downstairs kitchen speaker, it's definitely useful. Its sleek and simplistic design and functionality fits perfectly with the rest of the tech in my room. I can't fault it; definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Max H.

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality. Easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this turntable for my daughter, and she is extremely happy with it. Connecting to Bluetooth speaker easy and immediate. Sound is superb. I am old enough to have had a large vinyl collection in the early seventies. My daughter is picking up where I left off many years ago. She reports that the build quality of this turntable is very good, as expected from Sony. Do not understand reviews that may say otherwise. Easy to set up. A good automatic turntable. I highly recommend. As does my daughter. And excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good Steady Broad Appeal Sony Turntable
customer_reviews.text: Dead easy to set up. Good value for money sound quality for this pricing point. Looks good, packaged well and plugged nicely into an analogue port for existing speakers. Does have preamp. If you have records you want to play this is a good option. Like anything, there will always be cheaper and there will always be better - but I can rely on Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, sounds good, and by golly .....
customer_reviews.text: It was simplicity itself to set up, pair up, and start using. I am not an audio buff, but to my ordinary hearing the sound quality through my mid-price Bluetooth TV audio system was pleasing. I think it will be better when I can add dedicated hi fi speakers, but for now I am enjoying listening to vinyl I last played before I married some 30 years ago. Now Dobby is free, and looking forward to adding to his collection.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: It just wouldn't connect to my blue tooth speaker

customer_reviews.author: Liz Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Quality bit of kit

Haven't tried connecting direct to my amp, because the bluetooth sound direct to a speaker is great. Long range and stable. Easy to put together. Start / stop works great. No complaints. This has really revitalized our vinyl collection.
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Better than cheap versions
customer_reviews.text: Just like the old days, I was reluctant to buy a Bluetooth turntable because all of the ones I’d heard were awful. I have this linked up to a Samsung sound bar and the quality of sound is fantastic. Turntable has push to start and push to stop, plus a lift button, if you need to change tracks. Well worth the extra dollars.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic turntable & great quality

I have a Sony soundbar which compliments the turntable perfectly- it took care of all the syncing between player and speaker at the touch of a button, so no problems there either. All in all, couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: EGLD

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic

customer_reviews.title: Value for money

customer_reviews.author: D Williams

customer_reviews.title: A quality turntable with ease of use and producing a great sound.

The only minus was the urge to spent money on more vinlyls to play on this great device. Knowing nothing about turntables other than from online reviews, I decided on this one from a known manufacturer to trust our old treasured records with. Over the moon that I did.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth john anderson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect entry level

I have also used it wired and I can’t tell the difference (but I’ve never proclaimed to be an “audiophile”) Start and stop function is idiot proof, and great if like me you are likely to wake up in the small hours on the sofa. I would say a perfect entry to vinyl

One of the greatest brands all gone to pot. You pay more and stupidly i expected a product that works and customer service. I will return and try a product that maybe works and gives customer support. Never Sony again

customer_reviews.title: This turntable is simple, easy and awesome.

product_meta.title: Sony PS-LX310BT Bluetooth Turntable with built-in Phono Pre-Amp, 2 speeds and 3 gain modes
product_meta.description:
Relive the original vinyl experience with all the ease of wireless connectivity with the Sony PS-LX310BT record player.


Just touch the Bluetooth pairing button on your Sony vinyl record player to find your wireless speakers, sound bar or headphones and listen to your favourite records – from classic LPs to the latest reissues.


Whether you choose your to connect your Sony bluetooth turntable via wireless or plug directly into your home sound system, setting up the deck is easy, so you can get your vinyl spinning right away. All of this without the need for a separate amplifier, thanks to built-in Phono EQ.


The Sony PS LX310BT also comes with one-step auto playback for simple control. The record player automatically drops the tone arm, finds the groove on your record and gets the music playing. And when the record is over, you can just sit back as the tone arm returns itself to its resting position.


From jazz solos and rock riffs to classical arrangements and hip-hop beats on your Sony bluetooth record player, you can lose yourself in the warm, smooth sound of vinyl, thanks to the record player's finely crafted parts and construction.


This includes the new straight tone arm. The Sony record player comes with a redesigned and made from sturdy aluminium, it delivers rich, clear sound and punchy bass tones. You’ll also benefit from the thick dust cover, which muffles pressure from your speakers, so you can enjoy your favourite tracks with little to no distortion.


Featuring a belt-drive mechanism, the Sony PSLX310BT has an aluminium die-cast platter, which is robust and lightweight. The result? Your record stays stable as it spins for pitch-perfect playback.


The Sony turntable also supports phono and line output thanks to built-in Phono Pre-Amp.


Whether you keep your bluetooth record player in the bedroom for private listening or prefer to have it in the living room at the very heart of your home, the bluetooth turntable will fit seamlessly with your space. The vinyl record player features a clean, minimal design that makes your vinyl the star of the show and a refined, tactile finish that gives the deck the luxurious look and feel your music deserves.


Whatever you select from your collection, the Sony LX310BT vinyl record player adapts effortlessly. You can choose from two speeds – 33 1/3rpm and 45rpm – and you’ll find a 45rpm adaptor disc tucked neatly beneath the record player. You can even switch between three gain modes – low, mid and high – to get the very most from all your music.
